name: Base Pods.txt - Introduction
description: This section explains that Base Pods are stable and continuously running deployments of services on the devstack environment. They provide a reliable testing environment for teams to quickly test their workflows without needing to redeploy their services every time. Base Pods offer a stable foundation for teams to collaborate and test their integrations with upstream and downstream services.
use_cases: Providing a stable testing environment for teams
Enabling quick testing of workflows without redeploying services
Facilitating collaboration and integration testing between teams

name: Base Pods.txt - Base Pod Routing
description: This section explains Devstack's intelligent routing system, which ensures that incoming requests are handled by ephemeral deployments (temporary deployments created for specific services) whenever they are available. If an ephemeral deployment is not present, the request is handled by the base pod (a stable, long-running deployment). This allows developers to focus on creating ephemeral deployments only for the services they are working on, while relying on the base pods for all other dependencies.
use_cases: Handling incoming requests for services with ephemeral deployments
Handling incoming requests for services without ephemeral deployments
Allowing developers to create ephemeral deployments only for services they are working on
Providing a stable base pod for handling requests for dependency services
capabilities: Guidelines for maintaining stable base pods

name: Base Pods.txt - Base Pod Guidelines
description: This section provides guidelines and instructions for deploying base pods, which are fundamental components or building blocks for services in the Devstack environment. It likely explains the process, best practices, and considerations for setting up and configuring these base pods, which serve as a foundation for running and managing various services or applications.
use_cases: Deploying base pods for a new service
Setting up a development or testing environment
Configuring base pods for specific service requirements
Scaling or updating existing base pod deployments

name: Base Pods.txt - Deploying Base Pods for a Service
description: This section explains the process of deploying the base pods (initial version) of a service for the first time, and how to update the base pods to the latest version running on the master branch. It involves setting specific labels and configurations in the local Helmfile, and updating the Spinnaker pipeline to automatically patch the deployments whenever the production pipeline runs.
use_cases: Deploying the initial version (base pods) of a service
Updating the base pods to the latest version running on the master branch
Automating the update process for base pods using Spinnaker pipelines
